Job_Title: VP, Customer Experience & Digital, Group Business Banking
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values  Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services. Business Banking We develop integrated products and services targeted at helping small and medium-sized enterprises across the region progress through different stages of growth. These include innovative solutions and initiatives in areas of working capital loans, operational efficiency and currency exposure. Job Responsibilities Assessing benefits, define capabilities, ensure delivery in appropriate phases Define the customer experience, end-to-end customer journeys/processes for the platforms Develop business justifications, drive product vision, establish roll-out roadmap and implement accordingly, working closely with key stakeholders: 1.PD/ TB to make banking simpler for our customers 2.GTO on roadmap planning for tech build to ensure capabilities built within timeline & cost; Drive theimplementation of the digital capabilities 3.Sales to understand their pain points so as to create greater value for our internal users Define pre-agreed performance matrix required to be reviewed on an ongoing basis Driving local implementation efforts Ensure local team structure is in place to drive platform delivery & post-implementation BAU operations(managing content, drive local usage, etc.) Ensure countries to drive the execution of platform's development/delivery activities in accordance to agreed timeline Performing ongoing reviews for content enhancement Establish roadmap of local contents, features on an annual basis Review of VoC to identify opportunities to enhance experience/ features for customers Post-implementation monitoring against pre-agreed metrics Ensure countries' post-implementation adoption/support monitoring based on defined performance matrix Adoption monitoring of MIS and perform communication on performance matrix on an ongoing basis, e.g.no. of downloads, active/ dormant users), usability of features, penetration, etc. Job Requirements 3-10 years of relevant banking and/or consulting experience with Bachelor's degree. Experience as a business lead/ product owner in driving digital self-serve, engagement and transact capabilities implementation Strong business domain knowledge in business/ Small Medium Enterprise (SME) banking or related financial industry (E.g. Fintech, etc.) Good understanding of the business/ SME banking landscape in terms of products, services and typical banking applications Familiar with change management processes and project management fundamentals Experienced in handling regional level programmes/ projects Display strong analytical, problem solving, communication and creative skills Strategic forward thinking approach to challenges with outstanding communications, influencing, negotiating and persuasion skills Resourceful team player, passionate, diligent and resilient individual with ability to thrive in ambiguity Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Title: Technology Incident & Change Management, Associate | Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Technology Incident & Change Management, Associate | Singapore Description About this role About BlackRock: BlackRock is one of the world's preeminent asset management firms and an outstanding provider of global investment management, risk management and advisory services to institutional, intermediary and individual investors around the world. Your team: Come work with us at one of the world's top FinTech companies! The Command Center and Control team runs Incident, Problem and Change Management processes ensuring the stability of the Aladdin platform while supporting a fast pace of innovation for BlackRock and our external clients. Your role and Impact: You will be responsible for managing some of the most critically important production incidents and technologically sophisticated changes in the industry. An individual in this role will have the opportunity to build relationships with Business and Technology teams across the region and globe through exposure to financial market workflows, applications, and technologies both crafted and adopted by BlackRock. This role will put one in a position to develop the overarching knowledge of how several teams collaborate to deliver services to end users and drive business impact lead by a culture of preparedness and quality. A successful candidate will support Aladdin, seek critical business-impacting incidents and lead communication between business groups during production impacting incidents, communicate the impact of high-risk changes and releases to technology and business partners while securing approvals and consensus from the Change Advisory Board. This position is also responsible for coordinating security patching across the technology infrastructure including working early shifts or working weekends (both on a rotational basis) to support patch implementation with the mission to achieve the firm's compliance and security goals. You have: The candidate is encouraged to have proven knowledge and experience in all parts of the IT delivery life cycle. We are seeking talent that has a passion for technical troubleshooting, thinks in an innovative way, values teamwork, has emotional ownership, and will go above and beyond to help develop the company. Our team has wide and multifaceted abilities, but we would encourage applications from candidates with the following skills: 4+ years of experience in a production/application support or client services role; financial services a plus Experience operating within an ITIL framework Background in supporting critically important applications Ability to prioritize multiple concurrent demands Basic technical skills in the following areas - desktop technology, TCP/IP networking, UNIX commands, SQL queries, and an understanding of SDLC Excellent oral and written communication skills. Good interpersonal skills and attention to detail Ability to work both independently and as part of a team effort Quick learner who will learn new systems or processes, highly motivated individual who takes full ownership of responsibilities Your advantages: Knowledge of security standard methodologies, operating system patching, and CVEs Experience and knowledge of change control principles, methodologies, and tools Knowledge of cloud computing platforms like Azure, AWS, etc. and understanding of different service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) Scripting or basic development language skills to automate common tasks We are a global but close-knit team of individuals who share a common goal of providing the very best possible level of support to our business partners and customers. From the top of the firm down, we embrace the diversity of values, identities and ideas brought by our employees. We are serious about our people and offer Flexible Time Off, collaborative working spaces and several other benefits. If any of this excites you, we would love to speak to you! Our benefits To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children's educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment - the one we make in our employees. It's why we're dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit careers.blackrock.com | www.blackrock.com/corporate | Instagram: @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law. BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Distribution/Intermediaries Sales, Asset Management, Singapore Job Summary Singapore Permanent BBBH802949 Jan 11, 2022 Competitive Job Description Expand your Career with a Top Tier Asset Management Company Distribution/Intermediaries Sales, Asset Management, Singapore Our client, a top tier Asset Management firm, is looking for a candidate to join their Singapore office as a Distribution/Intermediaries Salesperson . The successful candidate will be responsible for the Retail segment of the Singapore and South East Asia wholesale business. The job as a sales manager includes building relationships with, selling to and developing business opportunities with both new and existing clients. Selling to clients includes a broad variety of activities ranging from identifying opportunities to delivery of in-depth fund and investment presentations to various divisions of our clients. The client segment coverage includes retail banks, insurance companies, IFAs, platforms and asset managers and the coverage within each client typically includes product teams, due diligence teams, ICs and RMs. Responsibilities * To develop business, build relationships and raise AUM with Retail retail clients in Singapore and South East Asia. * The client segment coverage includes (although not exhaustive) retail banks, insurance companies, IFAs, platforms and asset managers and the coverage within each client typically includes product teams, due diligence teams, ICs and RMs. * To fulfil day-to-day pitching of ideas, regular and adhoc servicing and reporting needs of our clients. * To prepare sales materials for our funds including presentations, placemats, brochures and write-ups. * To deliver presentations (covering market outlook, funds and educational topics) to our clients including end investors. * To work together with the marketing team to prepare and execute joint sales and marketing campaigns with our clients. Technical Engineer (Desktop, Network), Analyst Description About this role About the role: You can work with us at one of the world's top FinTech companies. We sell our Aladdin platform to over 200 of the top global corporations. We are a global but close-knit team of individuals who share a common goal of providing the very best possible level of support to our business partners and customers. From the top of the firm down, we embrace the diversity of values, identities and ideas brought by our employees. We are serious about our people and offer Flexible Time Off, collaborative working spaces and a number of other benefits. We have a wide and multifaceted stack and skillset, but we're particularly interested in meeting people with skills in some of the following: Strong Leadership, Data-driven Analysis, Linux, Networking Concepts, Distributed Databases, and Cloud Platform offerings like Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS, and Google. We are looking for someone with a strong background in supporting mission-critical applications, a track record in outstanding service delivery across infrastructure and problem-solving. Team Overview: Platform Client Engagement (PCE) is part of the Platform Services group within BlackRock's Aladdin Product Group. Platform Services enhances our client's experience through a scalable hub for Operational Support, Client Engagement and Control across the Aladdin Platform. Platform Services supports over 200 external organizations that leverage Aladdin through BlackRock Solutions (BRS) offerings ( https://www.blackrock.com/aladdin/home ). PCE plays a crucial role liaising between our Aladdin business and the Aladdin platform providing technical support for Aladdin clients, owning the technical implementation of Aladdin at new BRS clients and providing business development support and management of projects for client technology requirements. PCE is a fast-paced team operating in a dynamic environment and provides the right individual with challenging work and an opportunity to lead cross functional groups in achieving a wide variety of objectives. Job Purpose / Responsibilities: The candidate will work across functions within PCE to provide leadership and mentorship to accomplish the team's strategic goals. In this role, PCE develops strong working relationships with BRS relationship managers and teams across the Aladdin Product Group. Aladdin Client Technical Support and Technical Initiatives Provide second level troubleshooting of client technical issues. Coordinate the technology implementation for new BRS Aladdin clients. Coordinate maintenance and support of client connectivity Additional technical work in support of the Aladdin business Additional Opportunities Due to the dynamic nature of the environment, PCE provides the opportunity for team members to participate across several functions, including Disaster Recovery planning for Aladdin, working with development teams on enhancements to operational tools, as well as opportunities to take ownership of various initiatives. Qualifications & Essential Skills: A successful candidate is expected to possess and demonstrate the following: Solid technical acumen including basic cloud technology, desktop technology and basic TCP/IP networking Ability to diagnose and fix technical issues with Windows operating systems Strong interpersonal and communication skills Self-motivated, driven and able to work in a team environment Ability to resolve conflicting high-priority requirements Strong leadership skills, including demonstrated ability to integrate multiple technical disciplines in achieving a stated objective Results-oriented professional committed to personally driving objectives to completion, maintaining flexibility where an adjusted work schedule and/or evening/weekend work are required 2+ years of experience in a technical support engineer, desktop support engineer, IT help desk, or similar role, financial services is a plus Desirable Skills: Experience troubleshooting Java-based applications running on Windows OS Scripting or basic development language skills to automate common tasks Strong technical writing skills or previous documentation experience and familiarity with Confluence Azure AZ-900 certification desired, but not required Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or technical related certification desired Japanese language skills is a plus, but not required Our benefits To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children's educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment - the one we make in our employees. It's why we're dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit careers.blackrock.com | www.blackrock.com/corporate | Instagram: @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law. BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Job_Title: First VP, Decision Management Team Lead, Group Retail
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values  Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department Division Decision Management Solution is part of the wider Risk and Decision Management (R&DM) Division that is responsible for developing, implementing and monitoring risk and decision management models for UOB's Group Retail Bank. 'Analytics Support & Decision Management Solution' team has been set up to execute the initiatives to (1) equip R&DM team members with the right tools, e.g. analytics tool, data, infrastructure, and (2) support the enabling of analytics to the users within Group Retail segment. The Bank implemented the Decision Management Solution ('DMS'), for Singapore and regional subsidiaries (Vietnam, Indonesia, Thailand and Malaysia). The DMS Team Lead role will lead the Group DMS Team to drive and develop the rules configuration & framework, for Business as Usual (BAU) quarterly policy changes, scorecard project changes and guide Implementation Projects on DMS solution for both Singapore & subsidiaries. Job Responsibilities Role's main areas as follows: 1) Rules Deployment: Manage DMS Configuration team (functional specialists) for rules deployment (from Change Requests Analysis, execute changes (configuration), test planning & execution). 2) Rules Development & Framework: Guide DMS Configuration team to manage design & development of DMS rules framework and codes 3) Manage 'DMS change prioritization forum': As the solution supports various types of rules (e.g. business rules, credit / overlay rules, and scorecard rules), for multiple stakeholders, with different requirements and urgency. DMS team lead will facilitate deliberation among stakeholders. 4) Solution Governor of DMS solution: this role will handle administrative/ process matters (e.g. set up solution governance framework), system custodian functions and enhancements to the solution (e.g. change to the data platform, version upgrade). This requires he/she to work with vendor and IT, including project support for the DMS upgrade Y2022-Y2023. - Provide support to AS Head on development of DMS team and DMS related infrastructure framework - Manage DMS prioritization forum to deliberate on the Change Requests, Projects and issues pertaining to DMS, to drive discussion and issues resolution. - Responsible for DMS rules deployment - planning, executing, testing and monitoring. To oversee the team for design & development of DMS rules framework and codes, used for both Singapore and subsidiaries - Identify improvement areas and provide recommendations to users and Head of AS team. - DMS Governor - maintenance of DMS rules configuration ~ Establish governance process, e.g. ensuring entry / exit criteria, maker/checker & code review process are in place ~ Drive & lead 'DMS prioritization forum' (current monthly CR meeting with stakeholders o Empower functional specialists to perform analysis to facilitate the discussion / decision process & recommend proposals. Team Lead will review their analysis and findings for solution/ effective change implementation o Drive forum to prioritize Change Requests with different stakeholders o Present to stakeholders and/or senior management on the assigned topics o Oversee and coordinate DMS changes e.g. change of data model, version upgrade, release plan. o Owner of DMS Change request inventory and provide regular update /tracking. ~ Owner of DMS artefacts (e.g. Rules specification, Code release/version inventory, audit or IT documents, process inventory) - Rules deployment - manage team for development & deployment release for followings o Develop & maintain DMS configuration specification o Translate business requirements to configuration specifications through close interactions with business users and solving the business problem o Perform DMS configuration and DMS-UAT testing /support o Develop and maintain relevant documents (e.g. test scope, test plan, test scenarios, test results, and entry / exit criteria) o Provide an update to Analytics Support Head on progress and issues - Provide advisory and lead support (as 'Group role') to the regional team - Provide regular updates to Head of R&DM and senior management on key developments and issues - Lead discussions and issues resolution process including cross function projects with digital Bank (TMRW) or strategic programs in the Bank. Lead or participate to support the Credit Portfolio Management Program (CPM) for vendor evaluation, review solution design and RFP evaluation for similar rules decision engine for regional customer management module. Job Requirements - Undergraduate degree in a relevant program - Good Project management background; with experience in planning, dependencies management, risk / issues management, and stakeholder management - Experience in Rules Development & Coding with Experian solution for Credit Origination (PCSM) / Customer Management (PCCM) will be preferred. Experience in Decision Management Engine (e.g. Blaze, Triad ) is added advantage - 6 to 8 years' related experience in retail credit portfolio / policies management. Consulting and risk vendor experiences will be considered - Exposure to IT systems and implementation projects o Appreciation of the System Development Life Cycle and project management methodologies, to perform and/or develop team on business analysis, business process mapping and user requirements gathering o Able to assess upstream and downstream impact from changes - Self-starter, flexible with a proven record in people / Team management - Able to perform in a non-structured environment. - Strong interpersonal skills. Able to interact effectively with a diverse group of people, including senior management, business managers and technical people - Experience in Retail Credit underwriting, credit policy and digitalization of credit application process will be advantage - Proficiency in tools like SQL, Relational Database and experience in Credit Decision Analytical Data Management will be a plus - Experience in JAVA language or Business Rules Engine code development will be a plus, and good knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) /Artificial Intelligence (AI) driven solution for Credit Underwriting processing and Data Analytics Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Title: Citi TTS - Trade Asset Distribution Transactor (Vice President) - [21410164]
Job_Descriptions: Trade is part of Trade and Treasury Solutions and is one of the market leaders in providing Trade products to our corporate, PS and FI client base. An integral part of Trades growth strategy is our market leading ability to risk defease and distribute Trade assets. Trade Risk Distribution manages all activities related to the distribution, syndication, sell-down and insurance of risks related to "Trade" products, and the process of transferring / selling these risks, in order to achieve credit, cross-border, or balance sheet relief which is critical for the following reasons: (a) maintain a liquid asset book (b) achieve superior portfolio returns (c) manage asset levels (d) undertake large ticket transactions (e) overcome credit / cross-border / capital constraints The transactor would be an integral part of the Trade Asset Distribution team responsible for deal execution to achieve above objective on transaction and portfolio level basis Key Responsibilities: Distribution and risk defeasance of all trade asset classes: The person will be responsible for identification of the different avenues to defease risk related to a trade asset and execute the most optimal form of defeasance based on business needs Understanding of the different avenues of defeasance available including distribution, insurance, multilateral programs etc. Internal alignment with country / product / sale counterparts on what needs to be sold on specialized areas i.e Supplier & Receivable Finance FI (LCs and Loans), Export Agency Finance Fundamental ability to understand underlying Trade transaction and to communicate clearly to investors. Communicating with investors on transaction basis regarding specific transaction to be distributed Defeasance feedback / assessment: Provide up to date and timely feedback to the origination team on market pricing and appetite for trade assets. Conduct market reads for specific deals where necessary Managing "originate-to-distribute", trade structuring, clubs and syndications deals. Understand and negotiate legal documentation with counterparties (investors, insurers, multilaterals among others) Ensure that all asset sales adhere to Citi policy standard and any product programs which have been approved for use Foster a strong "one team" mentality and interact with key business stakeholders Contribute to the development of internal distribution systems such as T3 Qualifications: 6-10 years of experience Credit Risk and Trade Product experience Capital Markets Credit Risk Structuring or Credit Risk Management Experience Education: Bachelors/University degree, Masters degree preferred This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

Job_Title: Audit Manager - Rates, Currencies and Commodities - Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Audit Manager - Rates, Currencies and Commodities - Vice President The Audit Manager is an intermediate level role responsible for performing moderately complex audits and assessments of Citi's risk and control environments in coordination with the Audit team. The overall objective is to utilize in-depth subject matter expertise to ensure that the firm meets audit standards and regulations and to work with business leaders to determine solutions for emerging issues. The Audit Manager will be based in Singapore and report to the Senior Audit Manager in Singapore and focus primarily on supporting the audit coverage of the Rates, Currencies and Commodities businesses. The role will involve the risk assessment, annual planning, business monitoring and supporting the audit execution and reporting for the activities described. Responsibilities: Consistently develop, execute and deliver audit reports in a timely manner, in accordance with Internal Audit and Regulatory standards Review and approve the Business Monitoring Quarterly summary and serve as lead reviewer for all reviews Collaborate with teams across the business and determine impact on overall control environment and audit approach Manage audit activities for a component of a product line, function, or legal entity at the regional or country level Leverage a comprehensive expertise to manage a team Advise the business on change initiatives, while advancing integrated auditing concepts and technology adoption Recommend interventions to issues, propose solutions for risk and control problems, partner with Directors and Managing Directors to develop approaches for broader corporate issues Apply in-depth understanding of Internal Audit standards, policies and regulations to a specific product or function area Qualifications: 6-10 years of relevant experience Related certifications (CPA, ACA, CFA, CIA, CISA or similar) preferred Effective comprehension of business side of audit function and subject matter expertise regarding technology application Effective verbal, written and negotiation skills Effective project management skills Effective influencing and relationship management skills Demonstrated ability to remain unbiased in a diverse working environment Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications : 6-10 years of relevant experience Related certifications (CPA, ACA, CFA, CIA, CISA or similar) preferred Effective comprehension of business side of audit function and subject matter expertise regarding technology application Effective verbal, written and negotiation skills Effective project management skills Effective influencing and relationship management skills Demonstrated ability to remain unbiased in a diverse working environment Education : Bachelor's/University degree, Master's degree preferred Job Family Group: Internal Audit Job Family: Audit Time Type: Full time Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Head of APAC Credit Research Description About this role As the Head of Asia-Pacific Credit Research within BlackRock's Asian Credit and Fixed Income (FI) group, the successful candidate will be responsible for researching alpha generating investment ideas in Asian credit markets, driving the credit research agenda feeding into the Asian and global credit platforms, leading and managing a team of credit research analysts, and leveraging investment expertise across BlackRock's wider investment research platform including but not limited to US and European FI, credit, and equities platforms. Key Responsibilities: Alpha generation Conduct deep fundamental research to generate alpha ideas for Asian and global portfolios Present alpha ideas to the broader team and PMs Partner with PMs in developing country and sector views using fundamental models Set credit research agenda and deepen research process Craft and deliver a broad research agenda focusing on instilling best practice and investment excellence to deliver strong and consistent alpha Drive and monitor proactive idea generation on existing and/or new alpha opportunities Monitor and constructively challenge investment priorities and execution against those priorities, in coordination with the PMs and respective investment mandates Target best practices and standardization of the investment process across the platform Managing APAC research team Cultivate and maintain a high performing culture founded on meritocracy, skills, and teamwork Encourage versatility of the team across different credit products and different investment processes; monitor and incentivize ownership across all products Support the development and growth of talent Active participant on Investment Committees Along with other members of the Investment Committees, the candidate will be responsible for vetting and the approval of potential investment opportunities within the Asia-Pacific opportunistic private credit and loan strategies Attend monthly and ad-hoc meetings to ensure established processes and controls are adhered to, review due diligence and investment committee memos, challenge research thesis and review financial model assumptions Oversight of monitoring performance and harvesting post the portfolio build Leveraging BlackRock's wider investment research platform Develop relationships across BlackRock, including but not limited to US and European FI, credit, and equities platforms, to leverage and improve our insights Key Requirements: Proven track record of generating alpha, specifically across Asia Pacific Credit. Demonstrated fundamental research, analytical skills, with strong attention to detail Extensive China credit research experience and the ability to communicate with China clients in local language Excellent quantitative modeling and valuation skills Ability to manage competing workloads effectively, and deliver quality work on schedule Effective communication skills, both written and verbal Connections within the industry and proven ability to build and sustain internal and external relationships Experience managing numerous investment professionals in a complex, global environment and demonstrate the ability to work more broadly within an organization where information-sharing is critical to the success of all teams across asset classes Outstanding interpersonal characteristics, reputation, and team orientation, which will enable her/him to command the confidence, loyalty, and respect of investment colleagues and external constituents Experience in hiring, setting expectations for, managing and mentoring individuals and/or teams Our benefits To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children's educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment - the one we make in our employees. It's why we're dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit careers.blackrock.com | www.blackrock.com/corporate | Instagram: @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law. BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Accountable for delivering Programmes on time, within budget, and within scope. This individual will lead and coordinate cross-functional, cross-departmental, cross-company teams that are responsible for all aspects of a Project or Programme, from Initiation to Closure. Overall Technical Delivery: Responsible to track the quality, scope, timeline, effort (co-related to estimation, CRs, complexity), resources (includes GTO, business, vendor, contractor, Professional Services resources as well as operations Develop and execute the overall project plan and analyse project proposals which impacts the schedule and budget variance which in turn contribute to meeting the overall objectives of the project. Identify and schedule project deliverables, milestones and required activities and tasks. Technology Role: Work with GTO teams for the technical/Infra setup and systems connectivity (e.g. SFTP, RFTS, SSL Certificates) Work with Business unit, Information Security, Group compliance, ORM etc. on the Security Risk assessment, Outsourcing due diligence. Engage/coordinate with external vendors to conduct Vulnerability assessment and penetration testing on the digital platform. Work with Vendor, Contract Management team etc. on the Statements of Work. Track the Service Level Agreement. Stakeholder Management: Work hand in hand with Business Project Managers to manage project stakeholders and relationships - e.g. escalation, expectation, conflict, scope changes, etc. Ensure teams work in a collaborative environment Scope Management: Manage all changes to the agreed scope of work Review and assess all changes and impact to timeline and ensure all changes are approved by PSC Program and Project Governance: Prepare investment approval deck and manage approval of project by ITC/TAGC. Implement the risk mitigation plans Process Adherence: Partner with relevant stakeholders in ensuring that the system development methodology is followed and the relevant artefacts are delivered on time with quality, in adherence to the development methodology/approach Project Reporting: Measure, monitor and report progress to stakeholders at various levels of organization across the enterprise with the right quality, consistency in content. Implement project communication plan and review status reports prepared by project personnel and modify schedules or plans as required Requirement: At least 8 years of prior experience in Finance related projects (preferably Asset Management or Private Banking) with 3-5 years of experience in managing Digital platforms which includes web and mobile application. Demonstrated 8-10 years progressive management experience, including large-scale Project & Programme Management. Deep understanding of front to back development technologies (e.g. Restful APIs, React Native, etc.) Proven capability of leading teams across sites and geographies. Experience in managing vendor project implementations Project Management Professional (PMP) / PRINCE II certification is a plus.

Job_Title: Treasury & Trade Solutions APAC Commercial Cards Product and Risk Manager
Job_Descriptions: Treasury & Trade Solutions APAC Commercial Cards Product and Risk Manager  Vice President Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions ("TTS") is a leading provider of cash management, treasury and trade solutions to Financial Institutions, Public Sector and Corporate clients around the world. TTS Global Commercial Cards is a leading commercial cards issuer with the largest global proprietary network, successfully serving the needs of large local and multinational organizations for more than 40 years with over 14,000 commercial card programs, 6 million cardholders and approximately US$42+ billion in annual charge volume globally.The Commercial Cards business supports comprehensive and digital cards solutions across Travel, B2B and VCA, Purchasing, and Meeting & Events to Citis institutional clients. Commercial Cards business in Asia represents over 13 countries with 200+ employees across product, sales, implementation, client service and operations. The business is expected to continue to be a major engine of growth in Asia with focus on digital solutions, business to business opportunities, e-commerce and the commercialization of product capabilities and origination of new business. Momentum is strong with revenues having doubled over the last few years. The position will be part of the APAC product team of the TTS Commercial Card and will be responsible for key product management and risk management in the business. Key Responsibilities: Responsible for Commercial Cards Product Management, Risk and Project Management Work with internal partners across Treasury & Trade Solutions (TTS), Institutional Clients Group (ICG), and the Functional Partners  globally, regionally and in country to drive the growth of cards within the broader B2B space. Participate actively in Global and Regional initiatives and work groups representing Commercial Cards business. Oversee the product strategy for a portfolio of B2B commercial card solutions and services, including traditional Purchasing Card solutions as well as emergent solutions. Lead key projects for commercial cards business across the region. Excellent organizational and management skills and possessesa natural capabilityto monitor and track a huge number of tasks. Oversight on Outsourcing & New Product activities of the cards product. Support requests for management reviews and audit deliverables and documentation Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy Owns centralized activities, metrics, and controls for Cards governance entity at the regional level. Manage the quarterly, semi-annual, and annual attestation of the completeness and accuracy of the Cards governance entity. Manage risk & control management across risk stripes, particularly operational, regulatory, AML/ Sanctions risk for TTS Commercial cards product, process & systems. KEY COMPETENCIES / SKILLS Business/Industry knowledge/competencies Strong understanding of Product Management, Risk management and Control framework within Citi will be an important asset. Good understanding of TTS products and services, preferably Cards. An understanding of the Cards ecosystem, track record of partnership and collaboration with Operations and Technology. Track record of product or client management disciplines. The successful candidate must be both a leader and a team player, working with regional Product teams, functional partners, and functional teams globally Personal Attributes/Interpersonal skills Excellent presentation, communication, and analytical skills Strong collaboration skills, interpersonal and stakeholder management skills Drive for outcome and focus on execution Strong work ethic, positive attitude and strive for continuous self-improvement Ability to prioritize and work under pressure Organization savvy and professionalism; Collaborative Strong relationship skills to manage external and internal stakeholders Strong analytical skills to identify and prioritize key risks and recommend adequate corrective actions Adaptability and dynamism given the evolution of the Cards Business Ability and willingness to think out of the box and question the status quo Stakeholder management. The role will involve engagement with product management team, business managers, operations, Independent Risk Management function, and other 2nd and 3rd line functions at the regional and global level. Regional/Country/Global TTS teams  Product, Sales, Countries, ICRM, AML/Sanctions, Legal, Compliance, Credit Risk, Operations, and Technology and other global risk functions. QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE REQUIRED Undergraduate / Post graduate degree in Business, Finance or Economics or other commercial disciplines 8+ years of work experience in the financial services industry, preferably with experience in Transaction Banking and Cards ecosystem TTS product knowledge and country/regional product management experience Proven track record of successful product management Influencing/Collaboration skills KEY BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS Internal Regional/Country/Global TTS teams  Sales, Product, Services, Implementation and Operations Functional partners: Relationship Managers, Legal, AML, Credit Risk, Compliance, Operations, Technology, Country IBC, etc. External (on the need basis) Clients, Partners like Visa, MasterCard, Gemalto, Sykes, Hexaware

Financial Trainer Hong Kong / Singapore / APAC Company Brief Fitch Learning is a leader in financial services training. With unrivalled breadth and depth of training, the company delivers learning solutions for apprentices and graduates, to those with 10+ years' experience in Financial Services. A truly global company, we have offices in New York, London, Singapore, Hong Kong and Dubai, providing services to financial institutions across the globe. Fitch Learning is part of the Fitch Group which also includes; Fitch Ratings, Fitch Solutions, Fitch Ventures and Sustainable Fitch. Agile and fast paced, we are able to tailor solutions to a wide range of Financial Services clients with operations in more than 40 countries. We're looking for individuals with drive, flexibility and passion to help us deliver a world class service to our clients. In return, Fitch Learning offers a fast paced, dynamic environment with considerable support and stability that you associate with a larger corporate. It's a place where you can really make a difference. Role Purpose As an associate with Fitch, we'll collaborate with you to design and deliver training across a number of global markets programmes within banks, other financial institutions, regulators and multi-lateral organisations. Courses are delivered virtually, but also to in-house clients as well as public courses in various locations. Role Responsibilities You must be confident presenting complex topics, willing and eager to learn with a desire to develop both your classroom skills, both virtual and in-centre, and further your knowledge of the subject matter you will be delivering. To assist in the preparation of training material To have a full understanding of the objectives of the course, the participants and training material Role Requirements Essential: You must have a proven track record of training, both virtual and in-centre, in a professional environment; ideally to graduate, analyst and/or intern programmes for leading financial institutions. Fluent in Mandarin & English; ability to train in both languages Extensive wealth management experience from within a leading institution Excellent presentation and listening skills Effective communicator with a passion for education A passion for delivering learning utilizing a range of methods to calmly and coherently explain complicated concepts in an entertaining and engaging way Strong levels of professionalism and cultural awareness appropriate to our industry

QC Laboratory Analyst ( T his Position is based in Jurong Island ) Are you passionate about Chemical Manufacturing? Do you enjoy ensuring the production of high quality for Chemical Manufacturing? Join our Chemical Manufacturing team We are the leader in well construction and production. Our innovative physical and digital solutions improve efficiency, production and maximize reservoir value. Our team ensures high quality, consistency and reliability for all products throughout the complete life-cycle of our chemical manufacturing production process. Partner with the best As QC Laboratory Analyst, you are to perform various analyses to evaluate the quality of raw materials, in-process/intermediate materials, and finished products and ensure compliance with established standards. Ensure all laboratory activities are in accordance to HSE policies and legal compliance requirements. As a QC Laboratory Analyst, you will be responsible for: Testing of intermediate and finished products according to established standards and guidelines. Communicating results and status of batches to the relevant parties, suggest adjustments and/or corrective actions to operations as needed. Ensuring that incoming raw materials meet specifications. Recording all test results in LIMS, preparing quality reports and generating COA for outgoing products. Performing periodic calibration or verifications of laboratory instruments and equipment. Preparing of test solutions and reagents for laboratory use. Ensuring all chemical reagents and flammable material are stored/monitored according to allowable storage quantity and storage condition requirements. Retaining and storing of finished product samples according to shelf life/ retention period requirement. Conduct verification check and analysis if required. Assisting Chemist on quality and safety audits, validation, qualification and change control, failure analyses, corrective and preventive action response to nonconformity and/ or customer's complaint. Handling laboratory housekeeping, laboratory waste and ensure proper disposal according to environmental regulations. Carrying out all required responsibilities safely as described in the standard operations manual and performing other related duties To be successful in this role you will: Have ITE & Diploma in a Science Discipline (chemistry content) Fresh graduate is encouraged to apply Be willing to work on shift pattern and working in Jurong Island Have the ability to run appropriate tests with solid understanding of laboratory test equipment and proficiency with lab software (LIMS, SAP) Have good problem-solving, critical thinking, RCA/ analytical skills Have good working knowledge of various mathematical concepts (including fractions, ratios, and proportions) Have good vision abilities Have demonstrated ability to work independently with minimal supervision Have demonstrated ability to analyse and interpret data/ information Have the ability to lift and/or move up to 10-20 kilograms occasionally Work in a way that works for you We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns: Please discuss your preferred working patterns with the recruiter during the process Working with us Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other. Working for you Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect: Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities Comprehensive private medical care options Safety net of life insurance and disability programs Tailored financial programs Additional elected or voluntary benefits About Us: With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we're committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we're always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient. Join Us: Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let's come together and take energy forward. Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Hiring_Company: ICE Data Services Australia Pty Ltd
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Parul Kochery HR Manager, APAC View profile & contact ICE Data Services, a subsidiary of Intercontinental Exchange, is looking for high caliber sales professionals to join our growing team. The successful candidate will have a hunter type of profile and a background with emphasis on selling to new customers and generating additional business within existing accounts. Job Purpose ICE Data Services, a subsidiary of Intercontinental Exchange,is looking for high caliber sales professionals to join our growing team.The successful candidate will have a hunter type of profile and a background with emphasis on selling to new customers and generating additional business within existing accounts. The focus will be on growing business for our fast growing index business predominately into index or passive asset management firms, including ETF issuers, asset owners, sell-side research and structured product issuers.Additionally, the Sales Executive will work in collaboration with Account Managers and other IDS Sales Executives to identify opportunities for upsell and cross-sell within the existing account base. TheSales Executive is expected to have a comprehensive understanding of the customer use cases and business in general. Client meetings, presentations and preparation of RFP/RFI responses will all be an integral part of the role, as well as interacting with customer, internal business partners, and pre sales on detailed aspects of a solution. This role is ideally suited to a self-motivated individual who relishes being at the forefront of business activities and thrives on their own successes and those of the team. We seek an aggressive hunter with polished sales, pipeline management, territory management and closing skills. A solid financial industry data or solutions background is preferred. Responsibilities Exceed sales quota Solid technical understanding of Index strategies Be a subject matter expert in terms of the index business and landscape in Asia Pacific Identifying competitive threats that could cause potential risk to our index business Keep abreast of regulatory changes that may benefit or damage our index business Manage territory and work closely with colleagues to identify and close new opportunities Managed and develop strong client relationships Work closely with the product and business team to provide feedback on any client, prospect or partner requirements CRM and pipeline management Knowledge and Experience 5+ years track record of over-achievement sales experience Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills required Clear ability to hunt within sales territory and build strong relationships with key client stakeholders Ability to accelerate the sales process; generating leads, managing the proposal process, overcoming objections Previous experience working within a data/software vendor, Exchange,or trading firm Strong network in the index space Previous experience of developing relationships from a cold call or networking activity is highly desirable Collaborative, team-oriented player with drive to contribute to individual and group results Proficient in pipeline management and forecasting Well-developed IT skills, notably MS PowerPoint & Excel and Salesforce CRM

Software Developer (IT) Introduction to the role: Our client is currently at the height of its expansion, and they'll only grow further. They are looking to expand the financial ecosystems by converting complex financial systems into simple solutions, helping their clients make better, wiser and well-informed decisions. In less than a year, they've processed more than 4 million transactions and worked with more than 150 financial institution within the Asian region. When you come in: Build high quality, fault tolerant systems and products, owning all areas of implementation, frontend, backend, CI pipeline, automated test suites and operations Work with your product owner and business stakeholders to define the product and tech roadmaps. Mentor the engineers in your team. Engage with the wider engineering organization, making sure your tech roadmap aligns with the other teams. You would need to have: Production experience in Java, Springboot & AWS Familiar with Kubernetes and write your applications Docker first. An owner end to end, Frontend, Backend, CI/CD, Operations, understanding what it takes to build a resilient, scalable service and support it in production. Familiar with Server Side Rendering (SSR) and/or Static Site Generation (SSG) This could be your chance to work with a multi-million start-upesque company operating in the latest, most cutting edge technology. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified / contacted. For more information you can email Jessie Ng in our Singapore office on jessie.ng@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference Jessie Ng528842 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/Wsl0hY/software-developer-it-itcommunications-singapore-central-singapore-15002554 Job Reference: Jessie Ng 528842 EA Registration No.: R2198861, Jessie Ng Chia Xi Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA License No. 10C4544

Join our team of Wealth ManagementConsultants today! Build strong clientele relationships by providing financial advisory services and products to meet the needs of individuals and companies. Consumers today no longer look at just products from one insurer or provider. In PIAS, we work with about 90 providers to provide holistic advice and wealth management. This will save advisers lots of time wasted when they are limited to only a selected range of products while smart clients know that there are better products out there. Stop being treated like a Salesperson and begin your journey with us as a Wealth ManagementConsultantrespected by clients. Your future in this industry relies heavily on the quality of clientele you are able to develop. We welcome you to enquire more about this career and its benefits. Job_Title: Operations Analyst - Responsible for Client Due Diligence - 5 Months Contract
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Irfana Farhath Recruiter View profile & contact The role is within a team of associates in the Anti-Money Laundering Client Due Diligence (AML/CDD) onboarding function. The team covers new client onboarding and expansion across Global Banking and Markets (GBAM) as its core activities. These roles will support the Global Banking business. Responsible for completing AML/CDD checks in line with country standards and CIP/CDD procedures. Accountability to provide seamless delivery and client delight. Description: At least 4 years working experience in a similar role Control focused mindset and good understanding of regulatory and reputational risks (knowledge of APAC AML/CDD requirements a plus) Excellent presentation, communication and problem solving skills A proactive learner and self-starter seeking continuous improvement in all job-related aspects. Experience of working in an Asia/Global environment. Good written and oral English, Mandarin would be a plus Excellent communications and organizational skills Ability to work under pressure in a team environment. Ability to liaise with all levels of the firm and people with different experiences and backgrounds. Other qualifications  Strives to bring new thoughts and ideas to teams in order to drive innovation and unique solutions  Excels in working among diverse viewpoints to determine the best path forward  Experience in connecting with a diverse set of clients to understand future business needs  is a continuous learner  Commitment to challenging the status quo and promoting positive change.  Participate in and drive collaborative efforts to advance tools, technology, and ways of working to better serve an evolving client base  Believes in value of diversity so we can reflect, connect and meet the diverse needs of our clients and employees around the world What you will do Perform document gap analysis by self-sourcing and reviewing available documentation. Evaluating information available publically or through vendors for multiple Asian jurisdictions Liaise with sales/client teams to obtain and validate correct documentation Process AML/CDD by enriching onboarding requests in the system of record and performing enhanced due diligence as required Support creation of key business metrics Liaise with internal departments to support KYC issues - Involvement in ad hoc projects for new processes or industry initiatives Participate in remediations, internal/external Audits Requirements Control focused mindset and good understanding of regulatory and reputational risks (knowledge of Asian requirements a plus) Ability to work under pressure in a dynamic team environment. Ability to liaise with all levels of the firm and people with different experiences and backgrounds. Collaborate closely with business partners to onboard client locally and regionally.

Meta is seeking a talented attorney to join as Lead Counsel, Labor & Employment, APAC in our International Employment Law team. The position will report to our Singapore-based Associate General Counsel, Labor & Employment, APAC and is a full-time position located in either our Singapore or Sydney office, or fully remote in Singapore or Australia. Providing employment law advice on all aspects of the employee life cycle to our [emailprotected] team across APAC, including human resources, recruiting, payroll, people operations, compensation and benefits, immigration and employee relations teams. Partnering with internal teams to build processes and playbooks for recurring employee-related matters. Drafting and revising employment related agreements and policies, including offer letters, severance agreements, confidentiality agreements, employee handbooks, and other employment related documents, applicable to Metas various global employees. Providing training to offices across APAC regarding Meta policies and other employment/legal matters. LL.B. or equivalent degree. Qualified lawyer, ideally in an APAC jurisdiction. Minimum 5+ years of relevant post qualification experience in labor and employment counseling, with in-house experience preferred. Experience with labor and employment law in APAC, including performance management, compliance and investigation procedures as well as a willingness to learn employment law in new jurisdictions Candidate must be a hands-on worker and self-motivated, with the ability to move fast and learn quickly, organized but also comfortable in dealing with complex issues that do not have a clear solution. Candidate must have strong communication and interpersonal skills and be able to partner effectively with cross-functional teams to provide practical advice and bring strategic and scalable solutions. Candidate must be willing to work extended hours when necessary to connect with colleagues from other regions and be flexible to travel globally. Your browser doesn't support mapbox-gl library. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible todaybeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Quality in Life Swisstel Hotels & Resorts is a distinctive group of deluxe hotels where we put the emphasis on our people. We strive to provide a motivating and rewarding environment that attracts inspired and talented people who are willing to bring new ideas, use & develop their knowledge to reinvent their career path. Swisstel Merchant Court, Singapore is a luxury hotel ideally located close to entertainment and dining hotspots such as Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and Chinatown. The close proximity of the MRT to the hotel makes Orchard Road, Raffles City, all major tourist attractions and the financial hub at Raffles Place, within easy reach. The 476 guest rooms and suites cater to the needs of the most discerning travellers. The Swiss Executive floors offer luxurious rooms and suites and the Swiss Executive Lounge provides additional luxury and exclusivity. Specifically, the division acts as an analytics function of Group Retail segment, to drive decision making based on value analytics throughout the customer value chain. Job Responsibilities 'Analytics Support & Decision Management Solution' team has been set up to execute the initiatives to (1) equip R&DM team members with the right tools, e.g. analytics tool, data, infrastructure, and (2) support the enabling of analytics to the users within Group Retail segment. In this role, the project team member anchor to manage Quarterly Change Requests delivery and enable Data management & tools for R&DM analytics BAU and projects. On project basis, he/she will participate & guide the assigned Singapore data-mart/ SAS /risk models initiatives for PFS & PB. Key Responsibilities - Provide support to the Head of Analytics Support & DMS team on the development of the infrastructure framework within R&DM, for the areas related to the Quarterly Change Requests and Data / data-mart management - Deliver Quarterly Change Requests (QR) for R&DM > Responsible for managing the function R&DM change requests via Quarterly Change Request (QR) boat size and Group Retail Demand Management RCAB prioritization, for Singapore and regional subsidiaries. > Drive change requests requirements, business analysis on problem statement, use case and benefits for CR RCAB prioritization > Responsible for delivery and complete User Acceptance Testing (UAT) for Singapore's Quarterly CRs. > Manage stakeholders / buy-in process for R&DM Head and Group Retail Demand RCAB prioritization. - Enable R&DM on tools and data for analytics > Deliver the weekly / monthly regular refresh of R&DM internal SAS data-mart assigned for SG > Support Data Management Team Lead for data management /projects on business analysis of business problems, use cases on data mart, SAS data sets automation jobs and Qlik admin support for SG - Provide assignment basis support (as 'Group role') to the regional team for Quarterly CR and Data management - Provide regular updates to Head of R&DM Analytics Support & DMS, Head of R&DM and senior management on key developments and issues Job Requirements Qualifications - Undergraduate degree in a relevant program. - Experience and proficiency in tools such as SQL, Relational Database, SAS datasets and experience in Credit Decision Analytical Data Management will be preferred. - Strong Business Analyst experience and able to do process mapping of business requirements and data /tools enablers required. - 4 to 6 plus years' related experience in retail credit portfolio, data management. Consulting and risk vendor experiences will also be considered - Project management e.g. planning, progress tracking and reporting, risk / issues log management, will be an added advantage - Exposure to IT systems and implementation projects > An appreciation of the System Development Life Cycle and project management methodologies > Able to assess upstream and downstream impact from changes > Able to perform business analysis, business process mapping and user requirements gathering. > Able to create the User Acceptance Test (UAT) test plan and complete UAT - Strong analytical skills - Good interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. Job_Descriptions: Welcome to Brighter! Ready to be part of a company that is not only leading the market, but transforming in the most exciting way? In Singapore, we are a team of experts who believe in building brighter futures for our clients and community by redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and unlocking real health and wellbeing. At Mercer, we walk the talk: Voted #1 HR Consulting Company globally Recognized as Asset Consultant of the Year for 4 consecutive years by Asia Asset Management Named Best Employee Engagement Consultancy and Best Corporate Wellness Provider by Human Resources Online Great Package and Recognition Programs Energetic & flexible environment surrounded by supportive colleagues We take care of our people and we pride ourselves in our diverse and inclusive workforce with our people first culture. We make sure our people are continually learning and growing, providing them with outstanding career development, on-the-job learning opportunities and financial rewards. Most importantly, we are committed to making your journey with us meaningful and fun. The business: Our passion is making a difference in peoples lives. For us, its not just a business  its a mission. Our more than 20,000 employees work every day to improve the health, wealth, and careers of more than 110 million people globally. Its how we make tomorrow, today We are now seeking bright and ambitious individual to support our local C&B/Rewards Career Products team  compensation, benefits, mobility surveys as well as rewards consulting and in order to support our team and strengthen the growth of our APAC business, We are looking for a; Senior Compensation Consultant (Projects) What can you expect Provide expert rewards advice as a leading consultant running independently in deployed consulting projects across the region. Create innovative rewards frameworks and solutions, tailored and customised to each individual clients needs and issues Proactively lead business development activities and develop cutting edge proposals, in order to win and secure new consulting projects Provide thought leadership and point-of-view on latest developments in rewards practices at conferences and events Lead a team of analyst and consultants to successfully deliver rewards consulting projects. Senior Consultants are expected to independently present to clients Senior Management Team (e.g. CEOs and Board) and lead high profile meetings within the space with our clients. What is in it for you? Work for a market leader and the largest rewards consulting firm in Singapore. Join a vibrant culture and affable team and enjoy a flexible work arrangement. Run projects independently and stay intuitive in mastering presenting and securing a sale. Mentor analysts and consultants to help them to deliver rewards consulting projects Work with clients across a variety of industries and countries (consultants will be given the opportunities to lead consulting projects across ASEAN region) Conceptualize and lead your very own passion project with the aim of developing new products or solutions to bring to market Exposure to multiple domains in rewards, including advanced rewards projects such as Sales Incentive Plan design and Specialist Job Architecture design Employee benefits include :- Dental and vision care, TCM, gym membership, insurance coverage Opportunity to build your personal brand by speaking at HR conferences and client session We will count on you to: Facilitate senior stakeholder presentations to present proposed solutions and strategies Identify leads from the consultants in the Career business in Mercer Singapore, and sharing the best proposal to the client across different sectors/industries. Develop and provide a point of view for the big project proposals from a total rewards perspective and lead the decision-making processes to move projects along to completion, and make steady and agreed upon progress on assigned programs/projects. Develop, enhance, and monitor project management methodologies, ensuring that a streamlined process exists, and provides evidence that all projects are implemented and successfully delivered to meet standards and requirements. What you need to have: 7 years domain knowledge in either Compensation Consulting or Total Rewards across salary structure, grade levelling, job evaluation applications, incentive pay design, etc. Impeccable stakeholder management and presentation skills for proposal building, points of views, project outcomes to external clients Passionate about compensation Consulting
